acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on a LD50 value of >3600 mg/kg for rabbits (IUCLID (2000)), the substance was classified as "Not classified" in JIS Classification (correspond to Category 5 or "Not classified" in GHS classification).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on LD50 values of >5000 mg/kg (IUCLID (2000)) and >3750 mg/kg (IUCLID (2000)) for rats, the substance was classified into "Not classified".

carcinogenicity.rationale: There is a report that no significant increase in the incidence of any tumour type was found in comparison with the control groups in a rat 2-year oral test, and a report that paraffin was not carcinogenic in a long-term animal test (JECFA (1993)). Additionally, there is a report that no carcinogenicity was observed in 2 year rabbit and mouse dermal exposure tests (EHC 20 (1982)). Since the result by oral administration was obtained from a single species, classification into "Not classified" is questionable, therefore, classification was not possible.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data from in vivo mutagenicity tests. From in vitro mutagenicity tests, there is a report of a negative Ames test (in vitro mutagenicity test) (Pesticide safety information (Japan Crop Protection Association) (List open for the public) (1992)).

hazardous_to_ozone.rationale: This substance is not listed in Annexes to the Montreal Protocol.

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine or chlorine

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Auto-ignition point is 245 degC (NFPA (13th, 2002)) exceeding 70 degC.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid (melting point <= 140 degC) substances are not available.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups present in the molecule associated with explosive or self-reactive properties.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on results of "slightly irritating" in a rabbit test resembling Draize test (IUCLID (2000)) and "mild irritating" in a rabbit standard Draize test (RTECS (2008); Journal of the American College of Toxicology. 3 (3), 43, 1984), the substance was classified into Category 2B.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: There are results of "not irritating" and "slightly irritating" in rabbit Draize tests by 24-hour application (IUCLID (2000)). Additionally, there is a report that the substance produced slight erythema in only one of 20 volunteers in a human skin irritation test (IUCLID (2000)). Based on these data, the substance was classified as "Not classified".

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In a 90-day oral test in rats (0, 160, and 1600 mg/kg/day), decreased erythrocyte count and platelet count, vacuolated hepatocytes, development of microgranulomas and necrosis in the liver, development of microgranulomas and cell hyperplasia in the mesenteric lymph nodes, development of microgranulomas in the cervical lymph node, and increase in incidence of lymphoid-cell infiltrates in the base of the mitral valve were observed dose-dependently (JECFA 1056 (2003)). However, since the test was conducted at dose levels exceeding the upper limit guidance value range of Category 2, classification was not possible due to lack of sufficient data.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on a report that wax fumes can cause mild irritation to eye, nose and throat (PATTY (5th, 2001)), the substance was classified into Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation).
